title: str() on the pytest.raises context variable doesn't behave same as normal exception catch

labels.name: type: proposal
labels.description: proposal for a new feature, often to gather opinions or design the API around the new feature

body:
Pytest 4.6.2, macOS 10.14.5

```Python
try:
    raise LookupError(
        f"A\n"
        f"B\n"
        f"C"
    )
except LookupError as e:
    print(str(e))
```
prints

> A
> B
> C

But

```Python
with pytest.raises(LookupError) as e:
    raise LookupError(
        f"A\n"
        f"B\n"
        f"C"
    )

print(str(e))
```

prints

> <console>:3: LookupError: A

In order to get the full error message, one must do `str(e.value)`, which is documented, but this is a different interaction. Any chance the behavior could be changed to eliminate this gotcha?
